Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer's decision to reject Ms. Augusto's application for protection was based on insufficient evidence and unreasonable
Application_Facts: Ms. Augusto feared persecution in Angola due to her cousin's murder and mother's imprisonment; she sought refugee protection in Canada
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the PRRA officer's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution or danger upon return to Angola
Assessment_Factor: Evidence of risk, credibility of personal claims vs. documentary evidence
Procedural_Issue: Refugee claim dismissed by RPD, PRRA application rejected, judicial review sought in Federal Court
Credibility_Assessment: PRRA officer gave little weight to personal claims due to credible documentary evidence showing peace and amnesty in Angola
Evidence_Used: Police notification, friend's letter, reports of human rights abuses, documentary evidence of peace and amnesty in Angola
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on PRRA and risk assessment
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution based on family incidents and political situation in Angola
Evidence_Assessed: Personal affidavits, third-party letters, country condition reports
Relief_Sought: Granting of refugee protection or reversal of PRRA rejection
Governing_Rule: PRRA officer must assess evidence of risk of persecution or danger upon return under IRPA
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to overcome country condition reports
Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk of persecution in Angola
Cause_Description: Ms. Augusto feared persecution in Angola after her cousin's murder and mother's imprisonment
Evidence_Handling: PRRA officer considered all evidence but prioritized credible documentary evidence over personal claims
Evidence_Issues: Weight given to personal testimony versus official country documentation
Legal_Provision: IRPA sections related to Pre-Removal Risk Assessment
Evidence_Assessment: Balanced assessment conducted; documentary evidence deemed more reliable
Decision_Rationale: Decision was reasonable as it considered all evidence and relied on credible country condition reports
Decision_Making_Body: PRRA Officer, Federal Court of Canada
Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancy between personal claims and official reports on country conditions
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness of administrative decision under IRPA
